intro: Chamaecrista auricoma, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or bean family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Chamaecrista auricoma is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in sunny, open habitats.
